alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 7:35AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...TROPICAL DISTURBANCE TO PASS NEAR GUAM THIS WEEKEND... A tropical disturbance, Joint Typhoon Warning Center (JTWC) Invest 98W, is centered near 7N152E. Latest model guidance continues to show this circulation developing slowly over the next few days as it approaches the Marianas. Models are in fairly good agreement that the system will move through to the south of Guam, though this is subject to change as the circulation develops. There is a possibility that this disturbance could become a tropical depression by the time it passes near Guam late Saturday, but latest trends have been indicating a slightly lower potential that depends heavily on the storm forward speed towards the much more favorable wind shear environment near the region. This system is expected to bring increased showers and thunderstorms to the Marianas, especially Guam and Rota, over the weekend, with wet conditions likely Saturday into Sunday morning. Current rainfall estimates are for 2 to 4 inches of rain to fall between Saturday and late Sunday night. As Invest 98W strengthens and approaches the Marianas, increasing winds, hazardous seas, numerous heavy showers and isolated thunderstorms are expected. Locally heavy showers leading to urban/small stream flooding. Flash flooding is also possible Saturday into Sunday, albeit support for such potential is decreasing in the recent model cycles. Marine conditions are also expected to become hazardous, with wind gusts as high as 35 knots, and seas of 9 to 11 feet possible during closest passage to Guam in the Saturday thru Sunday time frame. Residents of the Marianas should monitor these changing conditions over the next few days and watch for any updates to the forecast. Follow these links for the latest forecast information: Public Forecast - https://forecast.weather.gov/product.php?site=gum& issuedby=gum&product=ZFP Marine forecast - https://forecast.weather.gov/product.php?site=gum& issuedby=gum&product=CWF Surf forecast - https://forecast.weather.gov/product.php?site=gum& issuedby=gum&product=SRF
